entry.title: Understanding Account Status in SAP Sales Cloud V2 ‚Äî and Why It Matters
entry.content:
When you open an account record in SAP Sales Cloud V2, one of the first things you‚Äôll notice is a field called Status.
It looks simple, but it actually controls how the account behaves ‚Äî not just inside Sales Cloud, but also when data moves to S/4HANA.

Let‚Äôs unpack it in plain terms.

What ‚ÄúAccount Status‚Äù Means

The Status tells you where an account stands in its lifecycle ‚Äî from being in preparation, to active, to blocked or obsolete.

Here are the standard statuses in SAP Sales Cloud V2 and what they mean in business language:

Status What It Means Typical Business Scenario
In PreparationThe account is still being set up. It might have incomplete details or is waiting for internal validation or approval.A new lead converted to an account, but your master data or finance team hasn‚Äôt approved it yet.
ActiveThe account is fully approved and ready for business. You can create opportunities, quotes, and orders linked to it.A customer you regularly do business with.
BlockedThe account is temporarily suspended due to an issue (credit limit, legal hold, compliance check, etc.). Users can view it but cannot create new business documents.A customer under financial review or with overdue payments.
ObsoleteThe account is no longer in use. It stays in the system for reference but is excluded from new transactions or replication.A customer that closed operations or moved to another entity.

Why This Field Matters to You

From a user‚Äôs point of view, Status affects what you can or can‚Äôt do with an account.

  • If it‚Äôs In Preparation, you probably shouldn‚Äôt create quotes or deals yet ‚Äî the data might still change.

  • Active is your green light for transactions and pipeline activities.

  • Blocked means ‚Äúpause‚Äù ‚Äî you‚Äôll need internal approval before proceeding.

  • Obsolete tells you the account is historical and shouldn‚Äôt be reused.

So when Sales Cloud behaves like it‚Äôs ‚Äúnot letting you pick a customer,‚Äù it‚Äôs often because the account‚Äôs status doesn‚Äôt allow it.

Impact on Data Replication to S/4HANA

Here‚Äôs where it gets important for integration scenarios.

When accounts replicate from Sales Cloud V2 to SAP S/4HANA, the Status directly influences what goes through and what stays behind.

  1. Only Active Accounts replicate to S/4HANA.
    That‚Äôs by design ‚Äî you don‚Äôt want half-complete or blocked customers cluttering your ERP master data.

  2. In Preparation or Blocked accounts do not replicate.
    They stay in Sales Cloud until they‚Äôre approved (status = Active).
    This ensures S/4 only receives validated customer data.

  3. Obsolete accounts are typically treated as inactive in replication.
    If already replicated earlier, changes might not sync anymore. They might need to be archived or deactivated manually in S/4.

  4. Status changes can trigger or stop replication.
    For example, once an account moves from In Preparation ‚Üí Active, it becomes eligible for replication on the next sync run.
    On the flip side, if an Active account becomes Blocked, new updates might stop replicating until it‚Äôs unblocked.

A Simple Example

Let‚Äôs say your sales rep creates a new customer called Greenline Logistics GmbH.

  1. The account starts as In Preparation ‚Äî master data team reviews it.

  2. Once approved, status changes to Active ‚Üí account now replicates to S/4HANA as a customer master.

  3. A few months later, they delay payments ‚Äî finance changes status to Blocked ‚Üí no new orders flow from Sales Cloud.

  4. A year later, the business closes ‚Üí marked as Obsolete ‚Üí record remains for reporting, but is no longer updated or synced.

This simple field keeps your CRM and ERP clean, synchronized, and business-ready.

Best Practices

  • Check before you create: Always verify account status before adding quotes or opportunities.

  • Use filters: Add ‚ÄúStatus = Active‚Äù filters in your account list views to focus only on usable customers.

  • Collaborate: If you see an account stuck in ‚ÄúIn Preparation,‚Äù follow up with your master data or finance team.

  • Understand replication timing: Changes in status might not reflect in S/4 instantly ‚Äî they sync based on your integration schedule.

The Bottom Line

Account Status in SAP Sales Cloud V2 isn‚Äôt just an internal label.
It‚Äôs a gatekeeper for your entire customer lifecycle ‚Äî controlling what your sales team can do and what data makes it to S/4HANA.

Understanding and using it correctly keeps your CRM cleaner, reduces integration errors, and prevents messy downstream issues in finance or logistics.

entry.title: Re: Replacement of string '&3' not possible in CDS View
entry.content:
I reproduced. I think it's a bug.  You can see via the context menu "Show SQL CREATE Statement" that it's completely wrong.

It's related to the character & plus unknown other conditions. It starts to go wrong with the third '&'.

I created one CDS view to define a column AMPERSAND whose value is the constant '&':

define view entity zzsr2_cds_view
  as select from t100
{
  key sprsl as Sprsl,
  key arbgb as Arbgb,
  key msgnr as Msgnr,
      text  as Text,
      '&'   as ampersand
}

I created a second CDS view with CONCAT(ampersand,'1') instead of '&1' and so on:

define view entity ZZSR2_CDS_VIEW2
  as select from zzsr2_cds_view
{
  key Sprsl                as Sprsl,
  key Arbgb                as Arbgb,
  key Msgnr                as Msgnr,
      Text                 as Text,
      cast(
        replace(
            replace(
                cast(replace(
                        replace(Text,
                                concat(ampersand,'1'),
                                Msgnr),
                        concat(ampersand,'2'),
                        Arbgb)
                    as abap.char(73)),
                concat(ampersand,'3'),
                'ABC'),
            concat(ampersand,'4'),
            'DEF')
         as abap.char(76)) as MessageText
}

The second CDS view replaces successfully &1 to &4:

I couldn't find a corresponding SAP note. I could only find some old notes about problematic literals like '%(' (2520242 - ABAP CDS: Using literal '%(' in where condition was not properly handled - SAP for Me)

That would be great if you can contact SAP Support.

entry.title: Re: How to set up multi-currency bank?
entry.content:
Hello @Chanaporn ,

Thank you for the screenshot. This message is standard in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition.

The reasons you encountered the error as indicated in the error message

  • Each house bank account in SAP has one account currency. Your bank account is THB.
  • On Post Incoming Payments, the transaction currency must match the bank account currency.
  • Entering HKD on a THB bank account triggers the error.

Two correct ways to post

Money credited to your THB account (no HKD sub-account)

    • Keep the transaction currency as THB.
    • Select the HKD invoice and enter the THB amount received.
    • SAP clears the HKD open item and posts the realised FX difference automatically.

You truly receive into an HKD facility

    • In Manage Bank Accounts, add another bank account under the same house bank with Account Currency as HKD.
    • Post the receipt using this HKD bank account with Transaction Currency as HKD.
    • If your real bank uses one multi-currency number, you can still model separate SAP bank accounts per currency.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Warehouse management storage bin (Cloud Public Edition)
entry.content:
Dear @jan_gold,

To verify the process, I recommend running Warehouse Inbound Processing (3BR). This process will allow you to verify your required strategy.

Strategy setting is performed in CBC and SAP, depending on your needs in this case free spot.

As an example, here are some options:

  • Define Putaway Control Indicator (104279) in CBC
  • Define Storage Type Search Sequence for Putaway (104731) in CBC
  • Specify Storage Type Search Sequence for Putaway (104733) in CBC
  • Optimize Access Strategy for Storage Type Search (104730) in CBC
  • Create Storage Bins app in SAP
  • Sort Storage Bins app in SAP
  • Warehouse Process Type (104391) in CBC

At the end execute scope 3BR to check if your strategy based on Inboud Delivery->GR-> WT(Warehouse Task) working and system proposes the first eligible free bin.

 Also available Extensibility for Putaway Strategies, more details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/d1cbe37558094876b1b07dea4ee55e9d.html

Best Regards

Dawid

entry.title: My Expert Playlist for SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin
entry.content:
TechEd is finally back in Europe, and I couldn't be more excited! This year, I'm going all-in on AI-related sessions.

Yeah, AI again... but hear me out

I know, I know‚ÄîAI is everywhere right now and it's easy to feel like it's overrated. But honestly? I think this is where the real innovation is happening. Not the flashy stuff, but the simple improvements that actually make our business processes better. That's what I'm looking for at TechEd‚Äîpractical innovation from SAP that I can actually use.

Here's what's on my list:

Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents - AD202
I hope this one will help me build AI agents that actually work (and not just in demos).

How to simplify administration tasks in SAP BTP with Joule - XP101
Anything that can automate my work and make my life easier? Sign me up.

Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub - AI100
Call me crazy, but I think future applications will be AI-driven without traditional UIs. This session should show me how.

SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse - DA203
Data is everything when it comes to getting good AI results. This might be the key piece I'm missing.

Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio - AI105
I need to understand how to combine skills with agents properly‚Äîthat's where things get interesting.

Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build - AD100
As a developer, I want to know what Joule can actually do to support my workflow. Vibe coding, anyone?

The AI stack is ready‚Äîare you? The challenge no longer is technology - CT1277
The million-dollar question: Is SAP's AI stack really ready for us? Can't wait to find out. üôÇ

It's not just AI, it's the key to innovation üòâ

Apart from all the AI stuff, I'm also looking forward to:

  • The keynote - expectations are high with Joule Studio just launching and TechEd being back in Europe
  • Community talks - want to hear something SAP won't tell you? Check these out
  • DemoJam - it's back after years (not just because of Covid)! Looking forward to seeing some cool innovations

Let's connect!

What's on your list? Going heavy on AI like me or checking out other tracks?

Not registered yet? Get your ticket

entry.title: Re: Unable to create delivery of return sales order in pu...
entry.content:
Hello @AshishTumpally 

The error occurred because the return item has a system status of COST. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, when the status is COST, it prevents delivery creation by design, which explains the BS051 message ‚ÄúCreate delivery not allowed (Sys. Status Cost).SAP Support Portal-2994466 - Error '"Create delivery" not allowed (Sys. Status Cost, object VB&)' (BS051) when creating an outbound delivery with reference to a sales order - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Select the Appropriate Process

Credit-only return (Lean Return, order type CBRE)
CBRE is a lean return used for refunds or credits. It‚Äôs not relevant to delivery. Do not attempt to create a return delivery‚Äîcontinue with the credit memo process. SAP Help Portal-Lean Customer Returns Processing

Physical return required (goods must be sent back).
Use Accelerated Customer Return (CBAR) and set Follow-Up Activity to 0001 Receive into Plant. With 0001, the system creates a returns delivery for you; then you post a Goods Receipt (gr). SAP Help Portal-Logistical Follow-Up Activities

If you‚Äôre already using CBAR but still encounter BS051

Make sure the sales order or item is properly costed. In Public Cloud, ask your Costing user to run the sales-order costing or confirm that the background costing job has finished. When the cost calculation is complete, the status updates accordingly, and you can create the delivery. If issues persist, submit a ticket under CO-PC-OBJ as recommended by SAP.2994466 - Error '"Create delivery" not allowed (Sys. Status Cost, object VB&)' (BS051) when creating an outbound delivery with reference to a sales order - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Discover the New Home of the SAP Customer Experience Value Map
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

As customer expectations evolve, the way you learn and connect should too. That‚Äôs why the SAP Customer Experience (CX) Value Map is now part of the SAP Community, so you can explore insights, share knowledge, and grow alongside experts.

Everything You Need, All in One Place

Instead of switching between platforms, you‚Äôll find all your enablement resources in one space. Within the SAP CX Value Map, you can explore curated learning paths, discover best practices, ask questions, and exchange ideas with peers and SAP experts.

You‚Äôll find resources grouped into six key areas:

  • Solution Introduction & Implementation ‚Äì Get resources to plan, deploy, and adopt SAP CX solutions effectively.
  • Release Management ‚Äì Stay aligned with quarterly innovations and product updates.
  • Operations & Performance ‚Äì Maintain business continuity, monitor performance, and ensure system stability.
  • Value Management ‚Äì Explore tools and methodologies to measure success and drive continuous improvement.
  • Security & Integration ‚Äì Learn best practices to protect your CX landscape and connect securely with other systems.
  • Change Management ‚Äì Support your teams through each stage of adoption and process evolution.

 

What You‚Äôll Find Inside

The CX Value Map combines expert-led guidance with self-paced learning materials:

  • Blogs and Articles ‚Äì Stay up to date with the latest enablement stories, tips, and insights from SAP experts.
  • Event Calendar ‚Äì Join live sessions, webinars, and workshops designed to help you learn directly from specialists.
  • Learning Journeys ‚Äì Build your skills step-by-step through structured, role-based learning.
  • Best Practices and Guides ‚Äì Access ready-to-use materials that simplify complex CX topics.
  • Continuous Quality Check (CQC) Services ‚Äì Keep your SAP CX systems running efficiently.

 

Why Explore the CX Value Map?

The Value Map connects you to everything you need to strengthen your SAP CX landscape:

  • Get faster onboarding through structured guidance and expert recommendations.
  • Stay current with release updates and community discussions.
  • Improve performance and adoption with focused learning content.
  • Collaborate directly with SAP and peers who face similar challenges.
  • Drive measurable results by linking your enablement activities to business outcomes.

 

Get Started Today

If you already have access to SAP Learning Hub, enterprise support edition, simply log in with a S-user ID or a Universal ID and visit the SAP Customer Experience Value Map in the SAP Community.

Explore, connect, and learn, all in one place.

Because when you understand your customers better, you create experiences that truly stand out.

Edmar Rodr√≠guez is a Topic Expert for SAP Enterprise Support value maps, specializing in SAP Customer Experience. With 12 years of experience at SAP and a background spanning roles in various customer support positions, Edmar is passionate about helping customers succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings.

entry.title: What happens when the current parallel line is decommissioned and a new one is set up
entry.content:
Hello,


we are currently setting up our parallel line.


My question is what happens if we completely decommission the current parallel line and then request a new parallel line.


Specifically, I would like to know whether the same system URL will be assigned as for the current parallel line, or whether it will change? 


I need to know it, because it affects also integrations which are set up on BTP such as integration suite and i want to evaulate how big is the effort for building up these things again, when requesting a new parallel line.


Thanks for your help.


Best regards


Philipp


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: What happens when the current parallel line is decomm...
entry.content:
Hi!

When the Main Line is stable and no further significant business configuration changes are required, it is recommended to delete the Parallel Line. Deleting the Parallel Line prevents unnecessary synchronization between the Main and Parallel Lines.

Once the Parallel Line has been created and used, its deletion will remove all associated content. Only the tenant URLs are retained. If a new Parallel Line is provisioned in the future in the future, the same URLs will be reused.

The average duration of the deletion process is approximately two hours.

For this process there are no prerequisites for deleting a Parallel Line, and this activity has no impact on the Main Line.

Note that if you already have a parallel line and you request a new one, the existing parallel line and its data will be deleted.

For the Parallel Line deletion process you can refer to the KBA: 3667434 - How to Delete a Parallel Line in SAP Central Business Configuration - SAP for Me

Related and Additional information:

  • Delete a Parallel Line | SAP Help Portal
  • FAQ SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, Parallel Line
  • Branch Your Main Line | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: RFQ to purchase order
entry.content:
Hi @sivakumar_k571 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manage RFQs ,  Manage Supplier Quotations, Supplier Quotation for more insights.

To summarise, the reason both materials appeared in Supplier A‚Äôs PO is because the award decision in th RFQ was not finalised at your item level.

Even if you intended Supplier A to win only for material Y, the system included both items because both lines were marked as awarded or not differentiated. You have to possibility to resolve (see attached demo) this by:

1. Going to the RFQ in Manage RFQ‚Äôs and set the award indicator per item.

2. Confirm the award through Manage Supplier Quotations.


3. When you create your PO, only items you award will transfer

You can also consider enabling Award per item in CBC to ensure you enforce control at item level.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Cracking the ‚Äú!‚Äù Mystery in SAP on Sybase ASE: Why isql Rejects Your Password
entry.content:
Recently, while working on an SAP system running on a Sybase ASE database, I encountered a deceptively simple but puzzling issue.
After completing the installation successfully, I couldn‚Äôt log in to isql ‚Äî even though the credentials I was using were 100% correct.

At first glance, everything appeared to be fine. The system was up, the user was valid, and the password matched what was set during installation. However, every attempt to connect resulted in a login failure.

After some investigation, I discovered that the culprit wasn‚Äôt the database or the user‚Ä¶
It was a single special character in the password: the exclamation mark (!).

Let‚Äôs walk through what happened, why it happens, and how to fix it.

The system was a standard SAP installation on Sybase ASE.
Post-installation, I tried logging in using:

isql -S<server_name> -U<user_name> -P<password>

Despite the credentials being correct, isql consistently denied access.
Since the password was auto-generated by the SWPM tool, it included a mix of uppercase, lowercase, digits, and special characters ‚Äî all in line with SAP‚Äôs own recommendations and SAP Note 2246903.

Initial suspicion: Special Characters

SAP Note 2246903 provides guidelines for valid special characters in ASE passwords:

Valid special characters:
(!@#$%^&*()_-+={[}]|\:;‚Äù‚Äô<,>.?/~\)`

It also emphasises that passwords with special characters must be enclosed in double quotes when being set or used, and that quoting rules differ between TSQL and UNIX shells.

That‚Äôs when I realised:
This might not be a database issue ‚Äî it could be a shell interpretation issue.

The Real Culprit: The Exclamation Mark (!)

In UNIX shells like bash and ksh, the ! character isn‚Äôt just punctuation ‚Äî it‚Äôs a history expansion operator.

That means the shell tries to interpret ! as a command reference (e.g., !ls recalls the last ls command). When isql receives the command, the password gets truncated or altered before it even reaches the database.

Let‚Äôs look at an example.

Suppose the password is:

a!terpwd123

 When you run:

isql -Usapsa -SD21 -Pa!terpwd123

The shell interprets !terpwd123 as a history event, so the actual password that reaches isql is just a ‚Äî causing the login to fail.

The Fix: Quoting the ! Character

To prevent the shell from interpreting !, we need to make it treat the character literally.

The trick is to wrap the exclamation mark in its own pair of double quotes, like this:

isql -Usapsa -SD21 -X -P"a"!"terpwd123"

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs happening:

  • The outer quotes preserve the string structure.

  • The inner "!" ensures the ! is passed as a literal to isql.

Now, the full password a!terpwd123 is transmitted correctly, and the login works perfectly.

Conclusion

If your SAP system on Sybase ASE uses a password containing !, the issue isn‚Äôt with ASE or SAP ‚Äî it‚Äôs with how the UNIX shell interprets the ! character.

The correct way to represent such a password in your isql command is:

isql -Usapsa -SD21 -X -P"a"!"terpwd123"

Summary

  • ! triggers history expansion in UNIX shells

  • Wrap it in quotes to pass it literally

entry.title: Re: An error occurs when running the Japan Withholding Ta...
entry.content:
Hello @yahaha 

You‚Äôre seeing ‚ÄúNo authorisation for the action‚Äù in Run Statutory Reports (F1515) because a required business catalogue is missing.

In Maintain Business Roles, add the catalogue SAP_FIN_BC_SRF_COMMON_PC to the user‚Äôs role, save, publish, then sign out and back in. Try New Run again. This is the officially documented fix. SAP Support Portal-3587016 - Authorisation error while running report in "Run Statutory Reports" application

In the user‚Äôs role, verify the assigned catalogue has Unrestricted access for Read, Write, and Value Help. SAP Support Portal-3432883 - User has no authorisation for operation READ on object SRF_REPRUN - Run Statutory Reports app

Let me know if you need further support.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cloud ALM documents uploading
entry.content:
Hi @sivakumar_k571 

Thank you for your question.

Currently, SAP Cloud ALM does not have its own internal file repository. The documents rely on integration with SAP BTP Document Management Service, which you have to subscribe separately to.

If you do not want to subscribe, you have two alternatives:

  • First is to use external document links for example SharePoint and link them in Cloud ALM deliverables.
  • Second is to use Cloud ALM public APIs to store your document metadata with external URLs.

If your tenant is on the latest 2025 release, check if embedded attachment upload is available under the documents tab. This offers a pilot feature that allows you to upload small files without BTP DMS.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

https://help.sap.com/doc/e22-sdt-sap-solution-manager-72-to-sap-cloud-alm/latest/en-US/e22-sdt-sap-solution-manager-72-to-sap-cloud-alm.pdf

SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Recommended Approach to Remove Inven...
entry.content:
Hello @nehaa0208 

Avoid posting to a cost centre (201) and refrain from reversing 561 unless the stock still precisely matches the original upload. The proper method below is audit-friendly.

Recommended approach

Transfer stock to temporary material (309), activate split valuation, then move it back to correct valuation types. Keeps everything on the balance sheet and is easy to reverse.  SAP Help Portal-CWM-Goods Movements

About your two options

Recommending against moving 201 to the cost center due to unnecessary P&L impact and a complicated audit trail.

Reverse 561 with 562 ‚Üí Only if the remaining quantity or value genuinely still represents the original upload and there have been no subsequent movements. Otherwise, it will not reflect the actual situation. SAP Movement Types in SAP Cloud Public Edition

Your OBD closure note

To close the EWM-relevant OBDs, use the Delivery Quantity Adjustment process with code O001 to set the quantity to 0 and complete the delivery. Do not attempt a GI for 0. SAP Support Portal-2659090 - Steps to zero out ODO via process code O001

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Assign Accounting Principles to Ledgers 4G
entry.content:
Good day @Andrea_Gr 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at: SAP Recommendation: Assignment of Corporate Accounting Principle to Ledger,

Assign Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes for more details.

In summary, the error you face occurs because the same accounting principle is assigned to multiple ledgers (0L and 4G) for the same company code. You can only have one ledger with local accounting principle assigned per company code in public cloud. Here is my suggestion:

  • Keep Ledger 0L assigned to Italian GAAP
  • Assign ledger 4G to a different accounting principle for example IFRS.

You can check assignments in the Assign Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes & Assign Accounting principles to Company Codes. This will eliminate the error once they are corrected.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Updating custom field extended for OPD view C_BILLING...
entry.content:
Good day @jyotis 

Thank you for your question.

This Video Tutorial: How to Configure Output Parameter Determination for Billing Documents will provide guidance.

Consider these references for more details.

Business Rules for Output Parameter Determination

Extending Billing Document Form Template with Custom Fields

In summary, I would not advice to use SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER to populate fields for OPD. Instead make use of BAdI SD_BIL_MASTER_MODIFY under the Sales billing document business context. This allows you to enrich the billing header before you save it.

Doing that will ensure that your custom field is populated before OPD runs and thereby enabling your EDI logic.

Best regards

Chris

Hello @sanjaynaiksap

CBO logic calls API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV, reads and Base64-encodes the file in 500-character chunks, aligned with SAP capabilities. Use BUT000 + leading zeros, call via CL_BLE_HTTP_CLIENT with a comm arrangement, and convert with XCO. SAP Help Portal3648499 - How to use API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV to download attachments for enterprise projects and professional services projects

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Where-used Table / CDS
entry.content:
Good day @F_Coutinho 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Extensibility & APIs for General Ledger Accounting

To summarise, the SKB1 or T004F are not made available in public cloud. This is because it does not fall under the clean core principle which public cloud is based upon.

You can, however, consider using released CDS views and public APIs to analyse your data models. Make use of:

  • View Browser app and filter released to yes, then search for I_GLAccountInCompanyCode. This is the released interface for SKB1.

  • Use Custom CDS Views to explore associated entities, which provides a similar dependency overview

Search for the API name, under details you will see data that is released to the table.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: New Partner Content on SAP Business Accelerator Hub (Q3 ‚Äô25)
entry.content:
In continuation of our previous blog, we are excited to bring you the latest updates and maintain the momentum of delivering valuable insights to our community.

In this edition of our blog series, explore the newest content packages (particularly APIs and Integrations) released on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub by our partners in Q3 2025, along with their high-level details.

For complete details on each partner's content, refer to the partners listing which is available on the home page of SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Incture Technologies Private Limited

Integration packages published:

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central with Third Party CSR Vendor - Benevity

This package supports integration of business processes in your on-demand SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central system with your Third Party CSR Vendor - Benevity.

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central with Third Party Benefits Vendor - Bswift

This package supports integration of business processes in your on-demand SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central system with your Third Party Benefits Vendor - Bswift

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PiLog India Pvt Ltd

API package published:

PiLog Data Profiling

PiLog Data Profiling automates the process of examining and analyzing datasets to provide insights into their structure, quality, and content. It generates detailed HTML reports that highlight anomalies, missing values, patterns, and inconsistencies, enabling organizations to ensure data accuracy and suitability for use. This process is critical for data quality management, supporting data cleansing, validation, and preparation for advanced analytics or decision-making. By automating profiling, it minimizes manual effort, reduces errors, and accelerates data assessment for real-time insights.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ComZam Datentechnik GmbH

Integration package published:

SAP Customer Checkout Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud

The integration of SAP Customer Checkout with SAP S/4HANA Cloud features the replication of relevant master data to SAP Customer Checkout as well as posting Point of Sale transactions to SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Cobrainer GmbH

Integration package published:

SAP SuccessFactors Talent Intelligence Hub Integration with Cobrainer Job Architecture

This package contains artifacts that enable the various integration scenarios between SAP SuccessFactors Talent Intelligence Hub and Cobrainer Job Architecture.

Navigate to the package mentioned above to know more about those supported integration scenarios.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Figaf ApS

Integration packages published:

Figaf Azure DevOps Integration

The "Figaf Azure DevOps Integration" package provides a template for integrating Figaf and Azure. It includes highly configurable iFlows processing Figaf webhooks for ticket/transport events to Azure actions, update Figaf based on Azure changes, and a utility for searching issues.

Figaf Jira Integration

The "Figaf Jira Integration" package provides a template for integrating Figaf and Jira. It includes highly configurable iFlows processing Figaf webhooks for ticket/transport events to Jira actions, update Figaf based on Jira changes, and a utility for searching issues.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sodales Solutions Inc 

Integration packages published:

Microsoft Booking Integration with SAP HANA

This package integrates with the Microsoft Booking API, enabling you to create and retrieve booking information. It helps streamline workflows, reduce manual tasks, and provide a unified experience across platforms.

Microsoft Teams Integration with SAP HANA

The Microsoft Graph API for Teams chat allows businesses to automate and integrate their Microsoft Teams chat functionality with a wide range of other applications and services. With this API, developers can programmatically send, receive, and manage chat messages within Teams, enabling seamless communication between systems and users.

Microsoft Mail Integration with SAP HANA

The Microsoft Graph API for email enables businesses to automate and integrate their email systems with various applications and services. It allows developers to programmatically access and manage email messages, folders, and attachments in Office 365 mailboxes. 

SAP SFTP Employee Data with PGP Encryption-Decryption to SAP HANA

This package automates retrieving a CSV file from an SFTP server, encrypting specific fields, transforming the data into JSON format, and sending it to a defined receiver, such as SAP HANA. It ensures secure handling of sensitive data while converting it into a standardized format for downstream systems.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Rojo Consultancy B.V.

Integration package published:

SAP S/4HANA Integration with Zycus

Zycus Accelerator for SAP S/4HANA delivers a fully pre-configured integration solution to help you replicate Cost Center from S/4 HANA to Zycus.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SirionLabs Pte Ltd

Integration package published:

Sirion Contract Lifecycle Management Integration with SAP S4HANA

The Sirion Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) Business Partner Replication Adapter for SAP S/4HANA seamlessly integrates supplier master data between SAP S/4HANA and Sirion CLM.  The Business Partner records initiated or updated in SAP S/4HANA are automatically replicated as Supplier profiles in Sirion CLM, ensuring alignment and consistency throughout sourcing and contracting workflows.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SPS Commerce

Integration package published:

SPS Commerce Supplier Integration with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

The SPS Commerce Fulfillment Connector for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enables businesses to effortlessly automate and optimize electronic data interchange (EDI) with trading partners, streamlining order-to-cash processes and enhancing supply chain visibility. This cloud-based solution offers easy configuration, scalable performance, and a single connection to thousands of retailers, vendors, and logistics providers, reducing manual work and errors while supporting business growth.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PriceFx AG

Integration packages published:

 

SAP S/4HANA Exchange Rate Integration with Pricefx
 
This integration package contains integration flows to replicate exchange rates from SAP S/4HANA to Pricefx. They can be used as templates to speed up your integration between SAP S/4HANA and Pricefx. You could modify message mappings and value mappings according to your needs.
 
SAP S/4HANA Exchange Rate Mapping with Pricefx
 
This integration package contains sample mappings required to replicate exchange rates from SAP S/4HANA to Pricefx.
 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Microsoft Corporation

Integration package published:

 

Microsoft Sentinel Solution for SAP ERP and S/4HANA
 
Use the RISE certified Microsoft Sentinel solution for SAP applications to monitor your SAP systems any-premise with Microsoft Sentinel, detecting sophisticated threats throughout the business logic and application layers of your SAP applications. Use of Microsoft Security Copilot ensure fast time to response on SAP incidents.
 
The Microsoft Sentinel agentless data connector for SAP uses the SAP Cloud Connector and SAP Integration Suite to connect to your SAP Netweaver based systems and pull logs from it, as shown in the attached image.

entry.title: Worklist for Imports declaration not generating post GR
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am facing problem while attempting to generate an Import declaration via the worklist after posting GR in S4H against an IBD. Can someone help based on what I have stated below?

The process for Import declaration goes as follows:

1. Create purchase order

2. Create Inbound delivery

3. Update inbound delivery with MRN and T1 doc type ( Header => Intl. Trade) for following fields: Prev Doc Type:  T1 transit document / Prelim. doc. no.: MRN number

4. inbound delivery creates a customs document in E4H

5. Post Goods receipt in S4H against the IBD

6. Create Import declaration via worklist in E4H (This is not working or I don't know how to make it work in E4H).

Configuration for Transit Procedure (Import Declaration) ‚Äì S4H:

1. Technical activation of document transfer for Purchasing Doc(MM0A), IBD(MM0B), and Material Doc(MM0C)

2. Control settings for Document transfer:

2.a. For MM0A, chose PO type NB with Doc cat F for Compliance, Customs, and Risk Management at Doc type level only

2.b. For MM0B, chose IBD type EL for Compliance, and Customs at Doc type level only and option checked for Transfer of Proc. Traffic (IP/PUCC)

2.c. For MM0C, chose 101B movement type for Customs at Doc type level only and option checked for placement into Customs status before GR

3. Define Preliminary Document type ‚ÄúT1‚Äù for Transit MRN

Configuration for Transit Procedure (Import Declaration) ‚Äì E4H:

1. Check Std Legal regulation definition for TRSUS with Legal code: 07

2. Check Std determination Procedure for Active Legal Regulation (Determination procedure: LETRS w/Partner Group Assignment)

3. Activate Legal regulation (TRSUS) at country level

4. Check Std Document type at Application area level: TRLOIM (Customs Shipment ‚Äì Inbound) with no changes to the standard settings

5. Check Std Document Type activation for Transit/Presentation/Excise Duty: Doc type-TRLOIM

6. Check Std Control Settings definition for Process scheme TRSUS for US transit and ensure Processes, Activity, Activity sequence, and messages are good to be used As-Is.

7. Retain Action Profile, Partner Group, Text Det Proc., Calc Profile, etc. from the Std setup

8. Assign Document type at feeder system or feeder system group level. Application Level MM0B ÔÉ® FS Doc type: EL to Doc type DTAVI

9. Assign Std Item Category at feeder system or feeder system group level. Application Level MM0B

10. Define Determination of Prev. Doc. Type from Feeder System at the receipt (T1- Transit Proc.- MRN)

11. Define Determination of Target Procedure from Prev Doc type for Collection (LECTPR- Transit Proc- Duty Unpaid -Transit)

12.Assign Determination Procedure for Active Legal Reg LECTR

Configuration for Customs Processing (Import Declaration) ‚Äì E4H:

1. Check Std Legal regulation definition for ACE with Legal code: 01

2. Check Std determination Procedure for Active Legal Regulation (Determination procedure: LECUS w/Partner Group Assignment)

3. Activate Legal regulation (ACE) at country level

4. Check Std Document type at Application area level: CULOIM (Customs Declaration) with no changes to the standard settings

5. Check Std Document Type activation for Customs Processing/Pre-Declaration: Doc type- CULOIM

6. Check Std Control Settings definition for Process scheme CUSUS for US Customs Processing, Activity, Activity sequence, and messages are good to be used As-Is.

7. Retain Action Profile, Partner Group, Text Det Proc., Calc Profile, etc. from the Std setup

8. Check determination of Activity Sequence for LR ACE and inherit the Std setup

9. Assign Determination Procedure for Active Legal Reg LECTR

10. Setup Default data per reqmt. (Define Default Data fields, Partner, Messages, Emails, etc.) 

Thanks in advance...

~Prashant

entry.title: Re: S-User not authorized even the authoriyation are assi...
entry.content:
As I checked in our backend system, I found your S-user is missing below authorizations:

  • Register Object and Developer Keys
  • Register Object Keys 
  • Edit my logon data

The above two is used to access SSCR Keys application to generate register developers or objects keys and the last one is used for maintain logon data when open the remote connections for the GUI system.

Regarding to create cases, your authorizations are limited on several installations, you can only create cases for these installations:

For the other systems or installations, you need to ask for relevant authorizations from your super/cloud admin.

To summarize, from my perspective, your S-user still has insufficient authorizations issue. I suggest you first contact your super/cloud admin for confirmation.

If you need my assistance, please provide screenshots explaining specifically for which systems you cannot submit a case, and show the error messages displayed when maintaining the remote connection and registering the developer key.

Then I will investigate further. 

Relevant article:

2453897 - How to request Object and/or Developer Keys (SSCR) for On-premise - SAP for Me

2436508 - How to access Customer Remote Logon Depot to maintain system logon credentials - SAP for Me

2710764 - Cannot access the Remote Connections application - SAP for Me  

 

Thanks and best regards,

SAP Support

DATA: lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch.
DATA: lv_batchnum TYPE string.

 ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Pass SAP C_TS410_2504 Exam with Confidence
entry.content:
Preparing for the SAP C_TS410_2504 exam may seem tough, but with the right approach, you can pass it confidently. This certification‚ÄîSAP Certified Application Associate ‚Äì Business Process Integration with SAP S/4HANA 2020‚Äîtests your understanding of key SAP modules like FI, CO, SD, MM, and PP.

Why It‚Äôs Important

Passing this exam proves your ability to handle integrated business processes within SAP. By practicing SAP C_TS410_2504 exam questions , you can strengthen your understanding of real-world scenarios and system workflows. It can open career opportunities in roles such as SAP consultant, business analyst, or system specialist.

Smart Preparation Tips

  1. Use the Official Guide ‚Äì Start with SAP‚Äôs official exam outline to focus on high-weight topics.
  2. Practice with Hands-On Tasks ‚Äì Work directly in SAP S/4HANA to connect theory with real processes.
  3. Review Sample Questions ‚Äì This helps you understand question styles and manage your time effectively.
  4. Stay Consistent ‚Äì Create a daily schedule and revise regularly to strengthen your concepts.

Build Confidence

Test your readiness with mock exams and trusted resources like CertBoosters. These help you practice under real conditions and build confidence before the actual test.

Final Thoughts

To pass the SAP C_TS410_2504 exam, focus on understanding integration, not just memorisation. Stay calm, manage your time wisely, and approach each question logically. With consistent effort and smart study, you‚Äôll be ready to succeed.

entry.title: Re: Cannot add Search Help to Custom Field - "No suitable...
entry.content:
Hello @nevenjakopcic ,

Thank you for sharing the screenshot.

What is causing the error, and what is the solution?

The error No suitable value help key field exists occurs when the selected value-help CDS does not expose a suitable key for binding. SAP‚Äôs KBA confirms this issue and indicates it relates to the key/length/type compatibility of the value-help view. SAP Support Portal-3603837 - "No suitable value help key field exists" when trying to change the Value Help View of a Custom Field

The value-help CDS should contain exactly one element marked as Value Help Key Field, and this element must be of type Text (Edm.String).

In your evaluation of YY1_PERSONNEL_Search, no element has been assigned as the key, and since the Personnel Number seems to be numeric, it will not be usable as a value help key.

Also check KBA 3207015 - Adding a Value Help with the Custom CDS Views App - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Non SAP System Integration with SAP GTS for complianc...
entry.content:
Dharmesh,

Calling the GTS API from the external application is the easiest way to process the master/transaction data and it would fetch the results just like GTS would do when plugged into ECC/S4H. But with direct call from the non-SAP system there is some extra work you will need to do to decode the messages and transmit back to the calling application in a consumable way that can be easily interpreted for an actionable response.

Alternatively, piggy back on the RFC's from ECC/S4H by calling it from the external application and let the native code in ECC/S4H do the decoding for you to be sent to the external application in a consumable way.

We used /SAPSLL/API_6800_SYNCH_MASS - API for Custom document creation/change for calling from Salesforce application via S4H to perform all the compliance screening. Our Master data system of record for GTS as well as Salesforce was S4H. Hence, there was no replication required for Master data from Salesforce as the data was timely transmitted to GTS from S4H.

Hope this helps.

Best,

Prashant

entry.title: TM Scheduling in Stock Transport Order
entry.content:
Dear friends of TM,

With SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS1 we published our first version of the TM based sales order scheduling (see respective blog post).

In this context we thankfully received a lot of feedback, and by far the most asked question has been whether we plan also to offer a TM based scheduling for stock transport orders. That‚Äôs why we published another blog post describing how this can be achieved with a modification-free customer own implementation.

Now, with SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS0 we can publish also a TM based scheduling for stock transport orders in standard, which will be described in the following.

Scenario

Like the TM based sales order scheduling, we‚Äôre integrated with Business Process Scheduling (BPS) in the following way:

  1. The requested delivery date from the schedule line of the stock transport order is the input for the BPS, where the calculation of the relevant dates is managed.
  2. Based on the requested delivery date, Transportation Management (TM) can calculate durations for loading, transport and unloading, ending up in a requested picking date by backward scheduling. From that, BPS calculates a requested material availability date as input for Available-to-Promise (ATP).
  3. ATP confirms a material availability date of the product from which BPS calculates the respective confirmed picking date.
  4. If this confirmed picking date differs from the requested picking date, TM calculates the confirmed delivery date with forward scheduling. Otherwise, the requested delivery date becomes the confirmed delivery date.

Key features

In its first version, the TM based scheduling of stock transport orders will not have equivalent functionality as the TM based sales order scheduling. Though, there are many similarities and it‚Äôs surely already usable very well.

Some of the key features are:

  • TM scheduling calculates durations for transport-relevant activities such as loading, transport and unloading during the creation of a stock transport order.
  • The scheduling in TM considers the transportation network as maintained in master data, e.g. default routes and straight line distances and durations. Also, Network Path Determination can be used.
  • The user can configure the sequence of routing methods how the scheduling in TM should be executed by the transportation duration determination profile at the TM control key.
  • Incoterm locations of the stock transport order are considered as the calculated delivery date relates to the arrival of the cargo at the incoterm location.
  • Delivery-based scenarios are supported where the freight units are only created during delivery integration. Scenarios without order or delivery integration are also supported.
  • Only scenarios with TM embedded in S/4HANA are supported, no scenarios with TM standalone.
  • TM scheduling is enabled on the level of document type / purchasing organization / purchasing group.

Example

Let‚Äôs explain this in detail with an example.

Prerequisite is the correct setup of the BPS:

So, you need to first create a schema or use an existing one. And afterwards this schema must be assigned in the ‚ÄòActivate BPS for Stock Transport Documents path.

Regarding the schema, see this exemplary one called ‚ÄòSTOCK_TRANSP_DAYS_ADV_ATTRIB‚Äô:

  • The loading duration is from the start of loading until the goods issue.
  • The transport duration is from goods issue until the delivery at the destination location (which can also be an incoterm location).
  • The unloading duration is from the delivery until the goods receipt.

Afterwards TM needs to be set up:

In Logistics Integration customizing, a TM control key needs to be assigned. This TM control key needs a TRS profile containing e.g. the planning profile with the loading / unloading durations and the routing method(s). Besides, the TM control key can be set up with or without TM integration depending on whether you just want to use the TM scheduling or also create freight units for the transport demands and use the further TM capabilities.

 If you now capture your stock transport order, the tab ‚Äòdelivery schedule‚Äô on item level will be filled with the information of the TM scheduling:

Best regards,

Michael

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud | Cost Estimation by Batch
entry.content:
Hello @hanna_tran,

Thank you for your follow-up and questions,

You asked, ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt create a standard cost per valuation type because CK11N lost the field.‚Äù
CK11N no longer requires a valuation type input. In S/4HANA Cloud, costs are generated and released using Fiori costing apps instead of CK11N. The cost estimates can now be created based on valuation types for split-valuated materials; this feature has been transferred to Fiori for both with and without quantity-structure processes. You then release the price per valuation type in Manage Material Valuations.  SAP Help-Material Cost Estimate Without Quantity Structure

And your second question: ‚ÄúCan we control costs from production into valuation types and through to GI?‚Äù
Yes, with the right setup:

Use Split Valuation (Single Batch Valuation) for SFG and FG, ensuring each batch has its own valuation type. This allows inventory values and COGS to vary by batch. SAP Help-Production Accounting Split Valuation

Run, mark, or release a cost estimate for each valuation type for the SFG and FG. The standard price is set at the valuation-type level, so the planned costs of SFG batches are included in the FG valuation type. At goods issue, COGS posts using the FG batch valuation type. SAP Help-Material Cost Estimate Without Quantity Structure

If you also want period-end ‚Äúactuals‚Äù by batch, activate Actual Costing (scope item 33Q) so the Material Ledger revalues inventory and consumption per valuation type at month-end. Actual Costing (33Q)

With kind regards

Chuma
